poem:
"An Unexpected Gift"

In the grand theater of governance, John Oliver stands,
Amid the great unraveling, an imploring command,
Would that surprise be medicine, not a sucker punch,
A storm of benefit blindsiding us, a voracious bunch.
For the children's sake and ours, we plead with open hands,
Dare the powers swoop benignly on these shifting sands.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "John Oliver on Medicaid mess: ‘Could the government blindside people with something beneficial?’ John Oliver dove into the bureaucratic mess of Medicaid on Sunday’s Last Week Tonight, amid a “great unraveling” that has dropped enrollment by more than 11 million people in the past year, including 4.8 million children, the vast majority of whom were kicked off their healthcare for surprise procedural issues. “Just for once, could the government blindside people with something beneficial, or". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
